assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
At the moment of performing the assessment, there is no Member State that includes XACML in their national catalogue with The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

National Interoperability Framework Observatory:  
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:

http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification was developed in 2001, by OASIS. It has been evolved over the years demonstrating that it overcame the possible issues raised on the developement and implementation. Moreover, the version of the issue being assessed is the 3.0, which enforces the maturity of the spec for its use in the developement of products and services. 

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification has been implemented several times and in different environments, open source and commercial. Some examples of XACML implementations are Balana, AuthForce, or Security Policy Pool.

Balana Github: 
https://github.com/wso2/balana

AuthForce:
https://authzforce.ow2.org/

Security Pool:
https://securitypolicytool.com/

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
XACML can be used independently from any other technical specifications or operating system. However, it is worth noting that since it is based on XML, it can be dependent on conventions and rules for the correct XML usage. 

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
XACML is a markup language that is used to declare access conditions stated on Security Policies. It can be adapted to ensure that web services are compliant with security policies, and therefore, ensure the data trustworthy exchange. 

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
The purpose of XACML is not related to data portability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification. 

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The application of the once-only principle in all EU Member States public administrations aims at reducing the administrative burden. 

XACML addresses and facilitates interoperability between public administrations, cross-border services, and impacts positively the development of eGovernment. This is because it has been designed to evaluate and control access by ensuring the compliance of security policies. 

Also, the project SEMIRAMIS, uses this specification to ensure secure channels for the exchange and reuse of information.

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

SEMIRAMIS project: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/semiramis/about

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement:
The purpose of XACML is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
The specification is aimed to participate in the evaluation of access policies, participating in authentication processes that can ease the secure and trustworthy exchange of data. An example of this fact is the European project SEMIRAMIS, a pilot infrastructure to provide e-services with the required underlying secure authentication

SEMIRAMIS project: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/semiramis/about

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement:
The purpose of XACML is not related to the  delivery of multilingual public services. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
By easing the creation of secured web services, XACML contributes to the increment of digital public services between administrations and stakeholders and among administrations. This public services can include Secure Data Transfer amongst other services. 

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

SEMIRAMIS project: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/semiramis/about

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
The purpose of XACML is not related  to the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are already existing documents and studies about the XACML performance in different environments. An example of this is the research article "A Performance Analysis of the XACML DecisionProcess and the Impact of Caching", which analyses the performance of XACML involved in the decision process of web services developed in the cloud and the impact of caching. Also, there is an article focused on the testing of XACML policies, which provides different approaches to improve effectiveness and effectivity.

A Performance Analysis of the XACML DecisionProcess and the Impact of Caching: 
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/283307011_A_Performance_Analysis_of_the_XACML_Decision_Process_and_the_Impact_of_Caching

Approaches for Testing and Evaluation of XACML Policies:
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/279192661_Approaches_for_Testing_and_Evaluation_of_XACML_Policies

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
XACML is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, XACML can define the interoperability aspects of the "Access Management Component", and  "Access Management Service" ABBs of the EIRA Technical View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
There are already existing tools for testing the implementation of XACML polocies. The Security Pool Policy allow to check for enhancements in a XACML implementation. Also, a tool known as WS2 Identity Server is available under its own licence to allow the testing of XACML implementations. 

WS2 Identity Server
https://docs.wso2.com/display/IS541/Using+the+XACML+TryIt+Tool

criterion_description: The specification is recommended by an EU Member State.
statement:
Germany is recommending XACML in their ICT National Catalogues.

Germany catalogue of standards:
https://www.din.de/en/about-standards/din-standards

CAMSS List of Standards:   
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
XACML is the basis of the Polocy Management impelemented by the cross-border project SEMINARIS. This projects aims to provide e-services with the required underlying secure authentication and management approach

Semiramis home page: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/semiramis/about

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of XACML within any European catalogue of standards.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en 

CEN search tool catalogue:
https://standards.cen.eu/dyn/www/f?p=CENWEB:105::RESET::::

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidences have been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of XACML is not related  to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0

The purpose of XACML is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

assessment_title: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: eXtensible Access Control Markup Language (XACML) v3.0
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
The XACML specification includes data structures and models that can be considered as reusable models for establishing data policies, the data involved and the processes involved.

XACML OASIS reference:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/xacml/3.0/errata01/xacml-3.0-core-spec-errata01.html
